DOC.brief_summary: The first aim of this study is to test the effect of the case management on the evolution of therapeutic alliance in patients with first episode psychosis in comparison with traditional nursing. The second aim is to test the effect of case management on nurses' well-being in comparison with traditional nursing. The third objective aims to show if therapeutic alliance is associated with insight in patients and with clinical and demographic data.
DOC.brief_title: Impact of Case-management on Therapeutic Alliance With First Episode Psychosis Patients (CAMAT)
DOC.criteria: Age between 16 and 30 years First episode psychosis diagnosis according to DSM5 criteria Lees of 16 years or more than 30 years Not fulfilling DSM5 criteria for first episode psychosis Any treatment with the psychologist or the psychiatrist of the team
